Per the Guidance Order, projects will advance through five stages5 during the pilot
period:
• Stage 1: Pilot project scope, feasibility, and stakeholder engagement
• Stage 2: Pilot project engineering design and customer protection plan
• Stage 3: Customer enrollment and pilot project construction
• Stage 4: Pilot project operation and management
• Stage 5: Pilot project review, recommendations
Details regarding financial and programmatic activities associated with each project by stage are
provided in the following sections of this report.

II. 
Chelsea Project  
 
A. Project Background
The Chelsea Project6 will create a UTEN that links an existing data center, located in a
commercial office building in Chelsea, with four nearby New York City Housing Authority
(NYCHA) low-income multifamily buildings in a disadvantaged community. This UTEN will
capture and recycle heat from the data center that would otherwise be released into the local
environment, and instead use it to provide heating, cooling, and domestic hot water services to
NYCHA Fulton Houses residents via heat pumps. Geothermal boreholes and an electric cooling
plant will augment the thermal energy provided by the data center. The Chelsea project will
provide experience harvesting excess heat from data centers, a major source of waste energy, as
well as test a model for future disadvantaged community and affordable multifamily building
participation in UTEN projects within a dense urban environment.
B. Project Activity (Currently at Stage 1)
